You can add additional Cisco WebEx Node For MCS to increase the number of web meetings, up to a maximum of four, for a total of 2000 web sessions (overall, not in a single meeting), in multinode deployments with Cisco WebEx scheduling., 73004=For additional information about supported IBM server equivalents, see: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/prod/collateral/voicesw/ps6790/ps5748/ps378/product_solution_overview0900aecd80091615.html., 125624=Audio only: 1200 (G.711) or 200 in high quality mode (G.722/G.729), 82944=1250, 58822=2.40 GHz E5-2665/115W 8C/20MB Cache/DDR3 1600MHz-2 (Sub-component of UCS B200 M3 Blade Server w/o CPU, mem, HDD, mLOM/mezz (UPG)), 83244=1750, 83427=1328, 56408=Cisco UCS VIC 1240 modular LOM for M3 blade servers, 59079=8GB DDR3-1600-MHz RDIMM/PC3-12800/dual rank/1.35v-3 (Sub-component of UCS B200 M3 Blade Server w/o CPU, mem, HDD, mLOM/mezz (UPG)), 122142=Table: Audio and Video Scalability Numbers for Cisco Unified MeetingPlace lists the maximum number of calls that are supported. The table assumes that the G.711 audio codec is being used and video is 320 Kbps. Many design external transcoding resources on DSP farms in Multiservice Routers to transcode G.722/G.729/iLBC codecs to G.711 before sending to MeetingPlace to achieve the G.711 codec capacities. See Planning the Capacity of your Cisco Unified MeetingPlace System for detailed information about System Resource Units (SRUs) that are used to calculate the capacity of the Express Media Server. The server listed is the server on which the Application Server resides., 43781=R2XX-CMAG3-1032, 110211=For additional information about supported IBM server equivalents, see: http://www.cisco.com/en/US/prod/collateral/voicesw/ps6790/ps5748/ps378/product_solution_overview0900aecd80091615.html., 124278=Audio: 2000 (G.711) or 1328 (G.722/G.729/iLBC), 32303=2.40 GHz E5-2665/115W 8C/20MB Cache/DDR3 1600MHz, 99017=Cisco ASR 1000 router, 124549=Audio: 2000 (G.711) or 1328 (G.722/G.729/iLBC)}
textBeforeTable: Component-specific requirements are indicated in the following table: LAN connection must support up to 1GB/s Install one virtual machine, per blade on a supported Cisco Unified Computer Server (UCS) For the Cisco UCS C200 M2, VMware ESXi 4.1 supports the VMware Standard or Enterprise Plus Edition license. VMware ESXi 4.1 supports only the VMware Enterprise Plus Edition VMware license for the Cisco UCS C240 M3, the Cisco UCS C220 M3, the Cisco UCS C210 M2, the Cisco UCS B200 M3, the Cisco UCS B200 M2. VMware ESXi 5.0 and 5.0 Update 1 (Release 8.5.5 [8.5 MR3] only) supports both the VMware Standard license and the VMware Enterprise Plus Edition license for the Cisco UCS C240 M3, the Cisco UCS C220 M3, the Cisco UCS C210 M2, the Cisco UCS C200 M2, the Cisco UCS B200 M3, and the UCS B200 M2. Virtual Machine Requirements For information about how to configure RAID settings on the UCS B or C series server, see the "Installing on a Virtual Machine" section of the Installation, Upgrade, and Migration Guide for Release 8.5 at http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/sw/ps5664/ps5669/prod_installation_guides_list.html. For scalability information, see Scalability for Cisco Unified MeetingPlace Release 8.5. For system capacity information, see
